alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:13PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Wharton and central Fort Bend Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kendleton, or 9 miles northeast of Wharton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sugar Land, Missouri City, Rosenberg, Richmond, First Colony, Pecan Grove, Fresno, Needville, Pleak, Fairchilds, Beasley, Kendleton, Thompsons, Greatwood, New Territory, Cinco Ranch, Riverstone, Cumings, Boling-Iago and Fifth Street. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
